subject: Creativity
title: Failure Kills Creativity: Why Getting It Wrong Gets It Right
description: A short lesson to help you apply Failure Kills Creativity: Why Getting It Wrong Gets It Right.

hook.text: WD-40 got its name because it was the 40th attempt. The first 39 were failures.

buildup.text: The myth says failure discourages creativity. But research shows that creators who experience early failure produce.

climax.text: Pixar's Ed Catmull says: 'Every Pixar movie sucks at first.' The creative process IS the process of making bad things.

punchline.text: Failure doesn't kill creativity. Fear of failure does.

quiz.question: What does Dean Keith Simonton's research show about creative scientists?
